content: Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Show in Finder, close TB, copy the .mbox file into Mail/Local Folders, renaming it if necessary. Remove the .mbox extension, restart TB, find the folder under Local Folders in the Folder Pane. Transferring the messages from Local Folders to an IMAP folder is a bit more involved and should only be done with small batches at a time, usually less than a few hundred.
creator: sfhowes

content: Wenn Sie in der Lage sind, auf Englisch zu kommunizieren, posten Sie bitte erneut auf Englisch. Andernfalls verwenden Sie bitte Thunderbird-mail.de
creator: wsmwk

content: You only see a checkbox to store passwords if the authentication method for the account is 'normal password', which is incorrect for gmail. Change it to OAuth2 for the incoming and outgoing servers.
creator: sfhowes

content: If you imported mbox files to TB, they would, or should have been stored in Local Folders, which exists only on the local computer, and do not sync with IMAP servers. The messages there can be uploaded to IMAP folders, but usually only with small batches of messages at a time, typically less than a few hundred.
creator: sfhowes

Už je aktualizováno na verzi 128.5.1 esr. Zmátlo nás tvrzení aplikace a kontrolou proti WEBu jsme problém s verzí již odhalili.

Vypnutí ESETu nepomohlo.

Nepomohlo odebrání a opětovné přidání oprávnění thunderbirdu v gmailu.

Nepomohla reinstalace Thunderbirdu, i když samozřejmě si chytil uložený profil (nejde o čistý reset).

Pomalu docházejí nápady.

creator: @next

content:
This may not help, but worth a try: - in windows file explorer, navigate to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles and there may be multiple profile folders. I suggest reviewing each to see if your lost data is there. IMAP files would be in the imapmail folder and POP accounts in the Mail folder and local folders in Mail\local folders. if you find what appears to be your lost profile, it can be restored. One way is this:

From windows desktop: - press the Windows key and 'r' - at the window that opens, enter thunderbird.exe -p and press enter - click the 'create profile' button and then cllick 'next' - enter a shortcut for the profile, such as LOSTPROFILE and then click the 'choose' button to locate and select the 'found' proflle - then click finish and launch
